[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Function: challenge()] [Medium - Instruction Set Binding] For DEX operations, are the complete instruction parameters bound before signature generation?

[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Function: append_message()] [Medium - Amount Encoding] When amounts are bound to transcripts, is the encoding (e.g., little-endian u64) consistent across all uses?

[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Function: challenge()] [High - Fork Race Condition] Between the clone and the Continued/Challenged updates, can a race condition cause one path to see a different transcript state?
[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Function: append()] [Medium - Length Encoding Edge Case] At exactly u64::MAX bytes, the length encoding wraps - is this handled safely?

[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Function: challenge()] [Low - Multiple Finalize Calls] If finalize() is called multiple times on the same digest (via clone), can internal state corruption occur?

[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Function: append()] [High - Length Conversion Panic] The unwrap() on u64::try_from(value.len()) is the only panic point - should this return a Result instead to allow graceful error handling?
[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Function: rng_seed()] [Medium - Slice Panic] The [.. 32] slice operation panics if output < 32 bytes - should this be checked at the type level?

[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Trait: Transcript] [Critical - Consensus Safety] The trait doesn't require Eq or PartialEq - can validators compare transcript states for consensus, or must they rely solely on challenges matching?

[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Function: challenge()] [High - Deterministic Clone] Does the Digest trait guarantee that clone() produces a bit-identical copy, or can implementation details vary?
[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Struct: DigestTranscript] [Medium - Debug Trait Leak] DigestTranscript derives Debug - can this leak sensitive transcript state in logs?
[File: serai/crypto/transcript/src/lib.rs] [Function: zeroize()] [High - Partial Zeroization] If zeroize() is interrupted (e.g., by panic in update()), can transcript state remain in memory?
